Although this trick is often harder to detect in a long
and complex argument, such reasoning is still indirectly circular if any premise
in a chain of arguments repeats or restates the eventual conclusion. Thus, we
have circular reasoningif and only if one of the premises that is used directly or
indirectly to support a conclusion is equivalent to the conclusion itself.
BEGGING THE QUESTION
Reasoning in a circle is normally bad reasoning, but it is not easy to say exactly
what is bad about it. T
